result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher Paul Merrill was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher Paul Merrill is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher Paul Merrill was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Christopher Paul Merrill was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Court dismisses Counts 2 - 12.
Defendant to report to Probation today March 2, 2016.
Court notes 15 days credit against ultimate sentence.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
DNA surcharge.
Apply bond on file.

-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Random and regular testing.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham December 4, 2017 - amend credit.

-Consecutive to Polk County Case.
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
-Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

-If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: Polk County

AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

to Review Bond filed by ADA Nieskes. hml
Surety's copy of Notice returned from PO; Resent to current address on 11/10/2015. km
Per EFV 11/5/15 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Pre-trial conference at 11-19-2015 02:00 pm

Additional $500.00 to be posted before release. 

And _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $10,000 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-Report every Saturday and Sunday before 5:00pm to Polk County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

--Defendant to make application to St. Croix band of Chippewa Tribe for treatment services and provide verfication of application and treatment plan to Court. 

-If Defendant is not in treatment, Defendant is to report every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturday before 5:00pm to Polk County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Defendant is prohibited from possessing firearms.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jessica W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Rohan. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY: Joseph Caton, DF:  Christopher Paul Merrill appeared from jail. Case called at 10:35 a.m. Court reviews file. ADA Nieskes notes Amended Complaint has been filed. Atty. Caton waives further reading and files questionnaire. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Crt finds probable cause and binds DE over for trial. Court informs Def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands. Atty. Caton enters NG pleas on all counts on behalf of DEF. Atty. Caton makes argument regarding bond modification. Atty. Caton requests bond modification. ADA Nieskes responds. Atty. Caton addresses Court. Atty. Caton requests speedy trial. Court amends Bond. Discovery and motions to be filed within 10 business days.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 04:45 pm.
Bail/bond hearing at 07-31-2015 10:30 am

and   _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2000.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex.


-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Jessica W.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
